result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Lamar Veasey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Agg.Battery-Intend Bod.Harm-Unborn Child [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.195(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count four, and concurrent with case 2014CM13.

Pay all applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid during period of Extended Supervision or civil judgment.  Bail to apply.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count three; and concurrent with case 2014CM13.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Stephanie H. without approval of the Court.  Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continued programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed approrpiate.
Pay the costs and fees for case 2014CM13.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendatn that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Bail Refund Packets
Count three.

Defendant Timothy Lamar Veasey in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Maxine Veasey (grandmother) and Carolyn Williams (mother). 

AS TO COUNT #3: Defendant sentenced to serve 7 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count 4) and (CONCURRENT to case 2014CM13), in the House of Correction with credit for 8 days time served.   

AS TO COUNT #4: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, (CONSECUTIVE to count #3) and (CONCURRENT to case 2014CM13) with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.    The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
--- Count #4).
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Stephanie H., 
   without approval of the court.  
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   -- pay the costs and fees for case 2014CM13.
   -- cash bail to apply.
* Restitution is set at zero.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Timothy Lamar Veasey in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1, #2 and #5, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #3 and #4:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-21-2015 at 1:30 pm.  

Court ordered cash bail in the amount of $2,000.00 on case 2014CM13. 

Court ordered that the defendant is allowed gps release for a TOTAL of 10 hours, prior to the date of the sentencing hearing on 5-21-2015, to remove items out of storage and move to a safer location.  Addresses and times of move must be verified with gps supervision.  All other conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Attorney Peter Kovac was also present in court.

State is requesting that cash bail be set in the amount of $10,000.00.  For the reasons as stated on the record, Court ordered that the signature bond on case 2014CM313 is now converted to cash bail in the amount of $500.00 with gps supervision.  The gps supervision is ordered on both cases 2014CF1286 and 2014CM13.  The Court will continue the discussion of bail on 3-24-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 4 to allow defense the opportunity to respond.
